moves.1. e4: A standard opener for me. It helps get my bishop and queen out.
moves.2. Nc3: I am now both attacking Black's pawn at d5 and defending mine at e4.
moves.2... dxe4: Again, not what I expected. I can now, however, take Black's pawn at e4.
moves.3. Nxe4: Now I set the score straight.
moves.3... f6: I don't see how this move helps the computer. It actually helps me now.
moves.4... g6: They now are trying to take my queen and block my attack on the King, I guess.
moves.5. Qf3: I thought that a retreat to here would be best, as a retreat to g4 could leave my queen open to a bishop.
moves.5... Bh6: I assume this is an attempt at a pin on my bishop at c1 and my pawn at d2.
moves.6. d3: This was a win/draw move for me. Either the bishop would not move and I could take it, or he would take my bishop and I could capture it with my rook.
moves.6... g5: I guess this was a draw move. I can't capture his bishop now.
moves.7. Be3: I'm still going to move my bishop at c1 to get it out on the board and allow queenside castling.
moves.8... c6 9. Qh5+: Yay for check! (again!) Notice how this would also be a fork with the bishop at h6 if not for the knight at g8.
moves.9... Kd7: Now they can't castle! Go me!
moves.10. Qg4+: Now I'm going to try to set up for checkmate.
moves.10... e6: Well, they did the thing I didn't want them to do. Now their king has better mobility. Oh well.
moves.13. h4 b5 14. hxg5: CAPTURE! Now I'm only 2 points behind.
moves.15. Qf7+: This might have been a fork if not for Black's queen.
moves.18. g3 h5 19. Bh3#: Checkmate! :) It took me 19 moves to checkmate.

gameName: Chess game against an easy AI
